title: A2328R - Research Assistant/Associate
text:
Research Assistant - £26,274 - £27,864 
Research Associate - £28,695 - £30,434 (with progression to £37,394) 
Applications are invited for an enthusiastic and highly motivated Research Assistant/Associate to work as part of the Standing Frames in Cerebral Palsy research team. 
You will coordinate survey development, dissemination and analysis; carry out face to face interviews with children with cerebral palsy and focus groups with their parents and professionals who work with children with cerebral palsy. You will maintain quantitative datasets and analyse these to inform the qualitative aspects of the study. 
You will have an undergraduate degree in a relevant area plus experience of research involving vulnerable populations and collecting and analysing qualitative research data in applied health research; a PhD is required for appointment at Associate level. 
You will have the ability to carry out research within agreed timelines, meeting project milestones and producing research to an appropriate standard as well as have excellent communication skills 
Further information can be obtained by contacting Dr Jill Kisler ( j.e.kisler@ncl.ac.uk ) 
This post is available from 1st August 2015 for up to 22 months depending on availability to start. 
The Institue of Health & Society is committed to supporting equality and diversity for all staff and students. Applications for part time/flexible working will be considered; please state your desired working arrangements in your application. 
The Institute holds a silver Athena SWAN award in addition to the University’s bronze Athena SWAN award in recognition of our good employment practices for women working in science, and the HR Excellence in Research award.
